meanings.definition: A grasping or squeezing of hands in greeting, farewell, or congratulation.
meanings.sent1: They exchanged warm handclasps as a sign of friendship.
meanings.sent2: The handclasps at the end of the meeting were firm and sincere.
meanings.sent3: The handclasps between the two rivals were surprisingly gentle.
meanings.sent4: Her handclasps were like bridges connecting hearts.
meanings.sent5: The memory of their handclasps lingered long after they parted ways.

meanings.definition: A device for holding things together, consisting of two interlocking parts.
meanings.sent1: The handclasps on the briefcase kept it securely closed.
meanings.sent2: She struggled to open the lock with the intricate handclasps.
meanings.sent3: The handclasps on the necklace were so tight, she couldn't remove it.
meanings.sent4: The handclasps on the gate clicked shut, sealing off the garden.
meanings.sent5: The ancient chest was sealed with ornate handclasps, guarding its treasures.
